profileAlternative.name: Ales Fiala
profileAlternative.headline: Software Engineer at Seagate Technology
profileAlternative.summary:
Software engineer with extensive experience in developing drivers, firmware, machine dependent code, graphics systems, and higher level application code in the Unix/Linux environment. Electrical Engineer background gives me insight into hardware subsystems and ability to write code at the hardware/software interface level. Experienced in all phases of the software lifecycle. Commitment to quality defect-free code. International experience. Fluent in Czech language. Remote work experience. Passionate about delivering products that make customer more productive.

Specialties: • Unix/Linux experience
• Drivers, firmware, embedded software
• X Windows
• Graphics display technology
• Quality
• EE background
• High performance code
• Debugging
• Troubleshooting
• Flexible, team player

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer, UNIX/Linux system software, C/C++, drivers, troubleshooting
positions.description:
Linux Kernel Maintenance
Responded to defect reports from customers. Ensured a trouble free operation of the customers’ mission critical system.

• Performed troubleshooting to discover the root cause of reported defects.
• Searched for defect fixes in the open source community.
• Coordinated defect fixes with Redhat and SuSE to ensure their release in next OS distribution.
…

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer, UNIX system software, C/C++, drivers, troubleshooting, software lifecycle
positions.description:
HP-UX kernel developer
Developed operating system code for HP’s line of mission critical UNIX servers.

• Developed machine dependent code to support new hardware and new software features.
• Responded to defect reports. Fixed defects and created patches for the OS. This minimized the downtime of the customers’ systems.
• Performed regression testing before each new OS release.
…

roles.title: Software Engineer, UNIX system software, C/C++, drivers, troubleshooting, software lifecycle

positions.title:
Title
Software Engineer, UNIX system software, graphics displays, C/C++, assembly, drivers, debugging
positions.description:
Graphics software development
Developed and maintained window system for HP-UX machines.

• Lead engineer for developing the X Windows product for HP-UX servers. Leveraged the display technology across server platforms.
• Developed drivers for HP proprietary and OEM graphics display cards on HP-UX workstations.
• Tuned the driver code to increase the display performance, allowing third party applications to run faster on HP computers. This made the HP systems be industry leaders for CAD applications.
• Ported the evdev input driver for X Windows to enable remote display technology. This allowed access to the computer console in a remote lights-out computer facility.
• Programmed the display card’s PLL circuitry to generate monitor timings for new monitors. This allowed the use of modern monitors with HP workstations.
• Developed Video BIOS firmware to initialize display cards and provide a boot console. This kept the device dependent initialization out of the OS and with the display, making the introduction of new displays easier.
…
see more

roles.title: Software Engineer, imaging, UNIX system software, C/C++, drivers, high performance code

given.text:
I worked with Ales at Hewlett-Packard in the Workstation R&D Lab developing graphics products for HP-UX workstations. Ales is an excellent software engineer. He is dependable and delivers on his commitments. Ales understands the underlying graphics hardware and system interactions, and he is able to write efficient, high performance code. He also has excellent debugging skills and can efficiently triage and fix complex problems.
…
See more
